intro: Pariana pallida, commonly known as the pale pariana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
